dt: {bc}to provide with meals at a mess

really {wi}messed{/wi} up my life
magnetic storms that {wi}mess{/wi} up communications
{wi}mess{/wi} him up good so he won't cheat us again
children like to {wi}mess{/wi} around with paints

dt: {bc}to handle or play with something especially carelessly

dt.t: don't {wi}mess{/wi} with my camera

dt: {bc}to take an active interest in something or someone

dt.t: {wi}messing{/wi} around with new video techniques
{wi}messing{/wi} in other people's affairs

dt: {bc}to become confused or make an error

shortdef: to provide with meals at a mess
to make dirty or untidy : disarrange —often used with up
to mix up : bungle —often used with up

dt.t: didn't {it}mess around{/it} with gangs

shortdef: to treat harshly or unfairly : abuse

dt: {bc}to spend time doing things that are not useful or serious {bc}to waste time

dt.t: We just {it}messed about{/it} all afternoon.
She spent the evening {it}messing about{/it} on the computer.
It's time we stopped {it}messing about{/it} and got busy.

dt: {bc}to have sex with someone who is not one's husband, wife, or regular partner

dt.t: His wife discovered that he was {it}messing about{/it} (on her).
Her husband discovered that she was {it}messing about with{/it} her assistant.

shortdef: to spend time doing things that are not useful or serious : to waste time
to have sex with someone who is not one's husband, wife, or regular partner —often + with

dt: {bc}to make a mistake {bc}to do something incorrectly

dt.t: About halfway into the recipe, I realized that I had {it}messed up{/it}, and I had to start over.
She's afraid she'll {it}mess up on{/it} the test.
I {it}messed up on{/it} my first attempt.

shortdef: to make a mistake : to do something incorrectly —often + on

dt: {bc}to cause trouble for (someone) {bc}to deal with (someone) in a way that may cause anger or violence

dt.t: I wouldn't want to {it}mess with{/it} him.
You'd better not be {it}messing with{/it} me.

dt: {bc}to deal with or be involved with (something that causes or that could cause trouble)

dt.t: The company doesn't want to {it}mess with{/it} small distributors.
He doesn't want to {it}mess with{/it} cocaine anymore.

dt: {bc}to handle or play with (something) in a careless way {bc}to mess around with (something)

dt.t: Don't {it}mess with{/it} the camera.

shortdef: to cause trouble for (someone) : to deal with (someone) in a way that may cause anger or violence
to deal with or be involved with (something that causes or that could cause trouble)
to handle or play with (something) in a careless way : to mess around with (something)
